alert.note: Alert for Edwards; Hodgeman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:29AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hodgeman, southwestern Pawnee and northwestern Edwards Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 429 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gray, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Hodgeman, southwestern Pawnee and northwestern Edwards Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Kansas.
